title.rendered: Big Step And Betting Ads Among Football Clubs In Social Media

content.rendered:
The Big Step is a football-based gambling project that focuses on spreading awareness among people regarding gambling harm. It is a part of the “Gambling with Lives” charity project as well which is set up by the families and friends of the people who took their lives due to gambling problems and addiction. This campaign urges football clubs to be more cautious about the problems of gambling addiction. 

The football clubs must change their approach towards gambling and become responsible about the effects of it.  The Big Step works solely for raising awareness among the youngsters and the football enthusiasts who get inspired to gamble after looking at promotions and advertisements. 

Betting Promotions Among Football Clubs

Regardless of gambling advertisement bans, the youth is getting exposed to the severe effects of gambling through social media advertisements and promotions as well as sports sponsorships. Much more UK punters decide to access independent bookmakers via CasinoGap that do not promote gambling in such harmful ways. However, this exposure causes brand recognition and helps is consumer buildup which are essential factors for any business. 

The ban of advertisements by BCG has many controversies going on because people feel that it could’ve been implemented earlier or there should have been an alternative way where people could choose to opt-out of such advertisements or promotions for personal benefit. Also, not all consumers face problems, it is exclusive to certain people. 

Now, with exposure, esports betting is even more popular and everyone has access to it which might again cause gambling addiction. Gambling sponsorships for football matches can never be ruled out unless there are other competitive sponsors willing to invest such huge funds in the company. That is why football clubs are bound to take up these sponsorships irrespective of the social harm it causes. Betting promotions via jersey logos or billboards might still be done. Educating and protecting the children should be done adequately in order to make them realize what is good and bad for them. Awareness is mandatory. 

Solutions For Gambling Addiction

The UKGC has launched Gamstop, a self-exclusion scheme in order to help addicted gamblers. It offers them a time period ranging from 6 months, a year or 5 years during which one has no access to the UK registered online casinos or gambling-related content. It has been helping punters ever since its launch and hopes to expand its success rate even more. Gamblers must sign up for the scheme if they feel that they are overdoing gambling. The Big Step targets the larger audience as a whole but does not provide individual solutions which Gamstop provides. Thus, one has to identify his own condition and decide to step up accordingly. 

Clash Between Big Step And Betting Promotions 

Gambling-related advertisements are everywhere in football. Promotions are done via video games, online pop-up ads, around the pitch, on T-shirts, and whatnot. For football fans, lucrative promotions may lead to initial gambling. It would have its own consequences. Statistical data says that 

  • There are over 500 gambling-related suicides in a year in the United Kingdom
  • Around 5 million people are severely affected by gambling 
  • Plenty of children start to gamble before 18 years of age

The Big Step along with “Gambling with Lives” is taking major initiatives in order to improve the relationship between gambling and football by taking to the clubs and explaining the downsides of such a partnership. 

Their main aim is to end the harmful effects of gambling and terminate the sponsorship altogether. 

Football and Gambling are two different industries that work on their own. Joining hands means that they are reaching out to a much larger mass which has its pros and cons since the issue is sensitive. Thus, whatever is portrayed to the people is taken as the final notion, even if it is negative. 

Conclusion 

Two industries might work individually and flourish as per their own sets of rules and regulations. Joining hands and spreading out messages or information over social media can be extremely harmful if the wrong audience obeys it. 

The Big Step has stepped into this scenario for a good cause. It aims to have a nicer society. However, gambling is a huge and successful industry and generates major revenues. If advertised properly and thoughtfully and maintaining its existing customers, the business would still keep its pace.
